Second minor performance tweak on fix to SDK-30308: iOS flag now static

Minor performance tweak on fix to SDK-30308: cache whether or not we're running on iOS to avoid unnecessary String parsing during touch scrolling in/around text fields.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
On iOS, hide keyboard when a text field (SkinnableTextBase) has focus and is editable if a touch interaction event (i.e. scroll) occurs.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
SDK-30236 - Pressing on the TextInput skin closes the softKeyboard
SDK-30356 - Tapping between TextInputs causes soft keyboard to disappear
SDK-30370 - SoftKeyboard is closed when tap into empty TextArea
When the softKeyboard is up, don't cancel the activating event. This causes the softKeyboard to close. Added fix to SkinnableTextBase.
SDK-30392 - SoftKeyboard closes when scrolling over a text component
When the softKeyboard is up, don't cancel the activating event if we start a scroll. Added fix to StyleableTextField.
QE notes: Verify on iOS and Android
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Fixing up maxWidth in SkinnableTextBase when the textDisplay is not a RichEditableText.  Needed to add some calls to super.maxWidth when maxWidth wasn't pushed down to textDisplay.
Also cleaned up some maxHeight code that wasn't being hit.
